// Win Lab 03 - Loops - Number Guesser.cpp : This file contains the 'main' function. Program execution begins and ends there.
// This program has you try to guess a hidden number that's in the range of 1 through 10.
// The Number is generated by a random number generator
// This program written by Kieran Bessert and Daniel Wertz on 1/28/2020
// Last edited on 1/30/2020

#include <iostream>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <time.h>
using namespace std;

int main()
{
    int number_To_Guess(0), number_Of_Guesses(0), guess(0);

    srand((unsigned int)time(NULL));    // This "seeds" the number generator
    number_To_Guess = rand() % 10 + 1;  // This gets a number and uses the modulo operator to constrain it to within the range 1 through 10

    cout << "This program will generate a random number between 1 through 10 for you to guess.\n";
    cout << "Please enter a positive integer number for how many guesses you would like.\n";
    cin >> number_Of_Guesses; // Promt user for how many guesses they would like

    for (; number_Of_Guesses > 0; number_Of_Guesses--) // As long as the number of guesses is above 0, give the user another chance
    {
        cout << "What is your guess?\n";
        cin >> guess;

        if (guess > 10 || guess < 1)
        {
            cout << "Guess is not even in range. Try again.\n";
        }
        else if (guess < number_To_Guess)
        {
            cout << "Guess is too low, guess higher.\n";
        }
        else if (guess > number_To_Guess)
        {
            cout << "Guess is too high, guess lower.\n";
        }
        else if (guess == number_To_Guess)
        {
            cout << "Congratulations! You guessed it correctly with "<< number_Of_Guesses <<" guesses remaining!!";
            number_Of_Guesses--;
            break;
        }
        
    }

    if (number_Of_Guesses == 0 && number_To_Guess != guess)
    {
        cout << "You are out of guesses.\n";
        cout << "The number to guess was " << number_To_Guess << ".\n";
    }
    
    return 0;
}
